title: Sega Archives 2016
description:
Since its origins as Service Games in the 1940s, Sega has been one of the most influential players in gaming history. From arcades filled with sit-down cabs, market-dominating consoles, an iconic mascot in Sonic the Hedgehog and everything in-between, Sega has certainly had its ups and downs. Sega brought so many new things to the gaming world, including downloadable games way back in 1994 and a motion sensing controller called the Sega Activator. The Mega Drive, know as the Genesis in North America, sold a staggering 30 million units. But Segaâ€™s hopes and dreams came crashing down around its ears with the Dreamcastâ€™s disappointing launch in 1998. It marked the companyâ€™s final foray into home consoles and ushered in the era of third-party software development for other gaming platforms. With Sega Archives you can relive Segaâ€™s colourful history, from early coin-op capers and the abandoning of the Master Systemâ€™s first mascot, Alex Kidd, to the gamble and subsequent failure of the Mega-CD and Mega Drive 32X. Weâ€™ve scoured the Retro Gamer archives to bring you amazingly in-depth articles on some of Segaâ€™s biggest games and franchises, as well as looking at the home consoles. Itâ€™s the perfect way to celebrate Segaâ€™s timeless achievements.

Sega Archives 2016
English | 180 pages | True PDF | 57.00 MB
